questiontext.text: A study was conducted to determine if crocodiles raised in captivity (i.e., in a zoo) grew faster than crocodiles living in the wild. Identify the explanatory variable and the outcome variable.

People who walk at least 3 miles a day are randomly selected, and their blood triglyceride levels are measured in order to determine if the number of miles that they walk has any influence on these levels.

In an article in the British Journal of Nutrition, two types of mice were randomly selected. One group received a thyme supplement for a specific time, while 足another group was used as a control group and received no supplements.The brains of the mice were then 足analyzed, and it was found that the brains of the group of mice that received the thyme supplements had antioxidant levels similar to those of younger mice. It was 足concluded that the thyme 足supplement increased the antioxidants in the brains of the mice.
A study was conducted to determine if workers who had a flexible work schedule had greater job satisfaction than those workers who worked a regular nine-to-five work schedule.

answer.text: Type of Work Schedule

questiontext.text: By 2040 at least 3.5 billion people will run short of water.
State the level of measurement: Rankings of golfers in a tournament
State the level of measurement: Temperatures of 10 toasters
State the level of measurement: Weights of selected cell phones
State the level of measurement: Salaries of coaches in the NFL
State the level of measurement: Times required to complete a six-mile bike ride
State the level of measurement: Ratings of textbooks (poor, fair, good, excellent)
State the level of measurement: Number of amps delivered by battery chargers
State the level of measurement: Ages of the players on a professional football team
State the level of measurement: Categories of magazine's in a physician's office (sports, women's, health, men's, news)
Marital status of nurses in a hospital
In a sample of 100 individuals, 36% think that watching television is the best way to spend an evening.
Time it takes 10 people to complete a New York Times crossword puzzle
Weights of lobsters in a tank at a restaurant
Colors of automobiles in a shopping center parking lot
Amount of garbage (in pounds) discarded by residents of a high-rise apartment complex
Capacity of an NFL football stadium
Ages of people living in a personal care home
The different species of fish sold by a pet shop
Number of street corner mailboxes in the city of Philadelphia
Relative humidity levels in operating rooms at local hospitals
Number of bananas in a bunch at several local supermarkets
In a survey of 1000 adults, 34% said that they posted notes on social media websites.
Ages of women when they were first married
Weights of the backpacks of first-graders on a school bus
Number of students each day who make appointments with a math tutor at a local college
Duration of marriages in America (in years)
Ages of children in a preschool

State the sampling method used: In a large school district, all teachers from two buildings are interviewed to determine whether they believe the students have less homework to do now than in previous years.
In a poll of 3036 adults, 32% said that they got a flu shot at a retail clinic.
State the sampling method used: All fast-food workers at a randomly selected fast-food restaurant are selected and asked how many hours per week they work.
State the sampling method used: Every 100th hamburger manufactured is checked to determine its fat content.

State the sampling method used: Mail carriers of a large city are divided into four groups according to gender (male or female) and 足according to whether they walk or ride on their routes. Then 10 are selected from each group and interviewed to determine whether they have been bitten by a dog in the last year.
State the sampling method used: People are asked to phone in their response to a survey question.
Allergy therapy makes bees go away.
Drinking decaffeinated coffee can raise cholesterol levels by 7%.
In a survey of 1500 people who gave up driving, the average of the ages at which they quit driving was 85.
Experts say that mortgage rates may soon hit bottom.
State the level of measurement: Pages in the 25 best-selling mystery novels.
Subjects were randomly assigned to two groups, and one group was given an herb and the other group a placebo. After 6 months, the numbers of respiratory tract infections each group had were compared.
A researcher stood at a busy intersection to see if the color of the automobile that a person drives is related to running red lights.
A sample of females were asked if their supervisors (bosses) at work were to hug them, would they consider that a form of sexual harassment?

Three groups of gamblers were randomly selected. The first group was given $25 in casino money. The second group was given a $25 coupon for food. The third group was given nothing. After a trip to the casino, each group was surveyed and asked their opinion of their casino experience.
State the sampling method used: A group of unmarried men are selected using random numbers and asked how long it has been since their last date.
Find the boundary (include units): 56 yards
Find the boundary (include units): 105.4 miles
Find the boundary (include units): 72.6 tons
Find the boundaries (include units): 9.54 millimeters
